intro: Obione dimorphostegia, commonly known as the two-form leaf fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive morphological features. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is native to tropical regions of South America. The plant exhibits dimorphic stegmata, which are specialized structures on the fronds, contributing to its unique appearance. Its fronds are typically lanceolate and possess a finely divided, feathery structure. Obione dimorphostegia thrives in moist, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
